meanings.definition: A defensive wall or other reinforcement built to strengthen a place against attack.
meanings.sent1: The ancient castle had tall fortifications surrounding it.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers worked hard to build strong fortifications around the city.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels thought the fortifications were a fun obstacle course.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was like a warm fortification against the harsh world.
meanings.sent5: The massive fortifications loomed over the landscape, intimidating any potential invaders.

meanings.definition: The act of fortifying or strengthening.
meanings.sent1: The fortifications of the building were completed just in time for the storm.
meanings.sent2: The fortifications of the treaty ensured peace between the two nations.
meanings.sent3: His morning coffee was his daily fortification before facing the day.
meanings.sent4: Her words were a fortification of encouragement during his difficult times.
meanings.sent5: The fortifications of his resolve were unbreakable, no matter the challenges he faced.
